core

Class Connect4

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.Connect4

  • public class Connect4
extends java.lang.Object
    The core components of the connect4 game.
    Version:
    2/16/20
    Author:
    Ryan Cluff, rpcluff, rpcluff@asu.edu

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int[][] board
      A 2D array representing the Connect4 board
      (package private) Player current
      Represents the current player (A reference variable used to point to the current player)
      private GameThread gameThread
      The user interface for the game
      (package private) Player notCurrent
      Represents the player which is not the current player (A reference variable used to point to the not current player)
      static int NUM_COLS
      Number of column for the Connect 4 board
      static int NUM_ROWS
      Number of rows for the Connect 4 board
      private Player player1
      Player object representing the first player (Will always be human player)
      (package private) boolean player1Turn
      Used to determine which player's turn it currently is (true for player 1, false for player 2)
      private Player player2
      Player object representing the second player (Can be human player or computer player)
      private boolean tie
      Indicates whether the game has resulted in a tie (The board is full, no possible moves)
      private boolean win
      Indicates whether the game has been won

    • Constructor Detail

      • Connect4

        public Connect4(Player player1,
                Player player2,
                GameThread gameThread)
        Constructor for the game. Initializes a 7x6 board and two players. Also sets up the current player and prints the initial board and player 1's turn prompt
        Parameters:
        player1 - Player object representing the first player (Will always be human player)
        player2 - Player object representing the second player (Can be human player or computer player)
        gameThread - a thread managing the game for both clients. Used to send ui updates

    • Method Detail

      • checkForTie

        private boolean checkForTie()
        Checks if the board is full
        Returns:
        true if the board is full, false if not

      • checkForWin

        private boolean checkForWin(int playerNum,
                            int col,
                            int row)
        Checks if the most recently added piece will result in a win
        Parameters:
        playerNum - the number of the player that placed the piece
        col - the selected column
        row - the row the piece would fall to
        Returns:
        true if the game has been won, false if not

      • computerPlay

        public int computerPlay()
        Returns the column the computer wants to place a piece. Computer will take into account which columns will result in a win for either itself or the player.
        Returns:
        selected column

      • getBoard

        public int[][] getBoard()
        Gets the board model
        Returns:
        the 2d array containing the board

      • getCurrent

        public Player getCurrent()
        Gets the current player whose turn it is
        Returns:
        current player whose turn it is

      • getRow

        private int getRow(int col)
        Returns the row the piece will fall to in the selected column
        Parameters:
        col - the selected column
        Returns:
        the row in which the piece would end in (the lowest empty row in the selected column

      • invalidCol

        private java.lang.String invalidCol(int col,
                                    java.lang.String name)
        Generates a message indicating that the selected column in invalid for play
        Parameters:
        col - invalid column (zero indexed)
        name - name of player
        Returns:
        "Column " + (col + 1) + " is not valid for play. Turn: " + name

      • playTurn

        public boolean playTurn(int col,
                        Player player)
        Process the turn for the current player. Will also process the following turn if player 2 is a computer
        Parameters:
        col - the column that the player has selected.
        Returns:
        true if the game is over (Someone has either won or the board is full)

      • tie

        private java.lang.String tie()
        Generates the tie status message
        Returns:
        "The board is now full, the result of the game is a tie!"

      • turn

        private java.lang.String turn(java.lang.String name)
        Generates the status message indicating which players turn it is
        Parameters:
        name - whose turn it is
        Returns:
        "Turn: " + name

      • validPlay

        private boolean validPlay(int col)
        Return if the selected column is valid for play. Checks if it is in bounds and if the column if full
        Parameters:
        col - the column to check
        Returns:
        if the play is valid or not

      • win

        private java.lang.String win(java.lang.String name)
        Generates win status message
        Parameters:
        name - the winner
        Returns:
        name + " has won the game!"
